posts.content:
Just wondering what people's opinions were on this? What channel do you get best at vanfest etc? I've always struggled with bbc2 at Malvern but anything I miss whilst the show's getting in the way, I watch on catch up when home. I was pleased at the all types show once in north Wales-I actually managed channel 5! I suppose it depends on your aerial too.
I hate missing the chase. I love Bradley.
What Programnes do you see at which shows?

I like to watch Top Gear whilst at victoria farm. I cant be bothered to talk to anyone after driving all that way. I just park up. Erect my mast and tweek my knobs until I see Clarkson fingering Hammond and then I'm happy . Sod socialising with anyone.
Oo. I managed to get eastenders once when i was at bad camberg. I couldn't believe my luck.

Reception is terrible at most shows so we have a dish now....I make sure the kids bring there fully charged Nintendo DS's and also their laptops as we've just invested in one of them mobile internet boxes.........were running short of power now though which is a shame we've had to put on hold the installation of a multicolour led light rope around our Martin Walter...there well cool.
Found my mio sat navigation tv worked on 2 at vic farm ?

I watched Quadrophenia one year at Brighton Breeze...just to get the true feel of the film
Those blackfez rocker type yobbos were no match for Sting and his boys

johnny k wrote:
Just wondering what people's opinions were on this? What channel do you get best at vanfest etc? I've always struggled with bbc2 at Malvern but anything I miss whilst the show's getting in the way, I watch on catch up when home. I was pleased at the all types show once in north Wales-I actually managed channel 5! I suppose it depends on your aerial too.
I hate missing the chase. I love Bradley.
What Programnes do you see at which shows?


Brilliant!!

I do struggle with a wifi connection though, perhaps its my router?

I find if i bring along some of my household chores…like the dishes…or small jobs that need doing around the house….or even some work from my day job
failing that, always make note of where the local supermarkets are, then you can nip out from the show and do your weekly shopping, save eating into the time during the week

If I can't get a TV reception, at least then I have something to fill my time
